DataElement.preferredName: Arizona Tobacco Survey Usually Inhale Tobacco Smoke Only to Mouth Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated response about whether they usually inhale tobacco smoke to only their mouth.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Arizona Tobacco Survey Usually Inhale Tobacco Smoke Only to Mouth
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A random, computerized, telephone survey of Arizona residents over 18 years old, conducted in 1996 and 1999, designed to track changes in tobacco use, the knowledge and opinions of Arizona residents about tobacco use, and the proportion of smokers advised to quit smoking by healthcare providers._A question about whether an individual usually inhales or inhaled tobacco smoke to their mouth only.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A random, computerized, telephone survey of Arizona residents over 18 years old, conducted in 1996 and 1999, designed to track changes in tobacco use, the knowledge and opinions of Arizona residents about tobacco use, and the proportion of smokers advised to quit smoking by healthcare providers.

Concepts.definition: A random, computerized, telephone survey of Arizona residents over 18 years old, conducted in 1996 and 1999, designed to track changes in tobacco use, the knowledge and opinions of Arizona residents about tobacco use, and the proportion of smokers advised to quit smoking by healthcare providers.

Concepts.definition: A question about whether an individual usually inhales or inhaled tobacco smoke to their mouth only.
